content: MISSOURI AND MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI RIVERS ENHANCEMENT PROJECT. The definitions in this section include the Middle Mississippi River, Missouri River, project, and Secretary. The Missouri River is defined as the stretch from its mouth to river mile 742. A project authorized by the Secretary of the Army will be developed within 180 days to protect and enhance the river. The Secretary of the Army will develop a plan within 180 days to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat of the Missouri River and the middle Mississippi River. The plan will protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat of the Missouri River and the middle Mississippi River without adversely affecting water-related needs like flood control and navigation. The plan aims to enhance fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River and middle Mississippi River region while considering water-related needs like flood control, navigation, and private property rights. Required activities include modification and improvement. The plan includes activities to modify and improve navigation training structures, create side channels, and protect fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River and middle Mississippi River region. The plan involves modifying and improving navigation training structures, creating side channels, and restoring fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River and middle Mississippi River region. It also includes the creation of island and riverine fish and wildlife habitat. The plan includes creating side channels, restoring and enhancing fish and wildlife habitat, creating island and riverine habitats, and establishing criteria for prioritizing activities based on cost-effectiveness and success likelihood. The plan involves establishing criteria for prioritizing activities based on cost-effectiveness and success likelihood, as well as physical and biological monitoring to evaluate project success.
